On the
["R-for-data-science" community](https://www.rfordatasci.com/) slack channel, we
are currently running a book-club to study
["Mastering Shiny"](https://mastering-shiny.org/index.html) by Hadley Wickham
(on Tuesdays at 5PM GMT).

Here are some resources that you might find useful if learning "shiny".

## General

Cheat sheets:

- [https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/master/shiny.pdf]

Books:

- [Engineering Production-Grade Shiny Apps](https://engineering-shiny.org/)
- [Outstanding User Interfaces with Shiny](https://unleash-shiny.rinterface.com/)

Competitions & Examples:

- [Shiny Gallery](https://shiny.rstudio.com/gallery/)
- [Winners of the 2020 Annual Shiny Contest](https://blog.rstudio.com/2020/07/13/winners-of-the-2nd-shiny-contest/)

Awesome Lists:

- [Awesome RShiny](https://grabear.github.io/awesome-rshiny/)
- [Awesome Shiny Extensions](https://github.com/nanxstats/awesome-shiny-extensions)

## Deployment

There are detailed notes on deploying to shinyapps.io in their User's guide:

- [https://docs.rstudio.com/shinyapps.io/getting-started.html#deploying-applications]

Notes on how to setup Digital Ocean or AWS to deploy shiny apps can be found
here (thanks to TanHo for pointing these out):

- [https://deanattali.com/2015/05/09/setup-rstudio-shiny-server-digital-ocean/]
- [https://www.charlesbordet.com/en/guide-shiny-aws/]
